title: Calico Bean Casserole Recipe
description: This calico bean casserole is made with ground beef, bacon, and onion baked with kidney beans, beans with pork, and butter beans for a hearty dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Beans and Peas Baked Bean Recipes Calico Bean Casserole 4.6 (374) 295 Reviews 24 Photos This calico bean casserole features kidney beans, baked beans, and butter beans combined with ground beef, bacon, and onion. This baked dish is thick, hearty, and pretty tasty, too! It can also be made in a slow cooker. Submitted by Dee Dee Updated on December 6, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 24 24 24 24 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 55 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 1 (9x13-inch) casserole Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 pound lean ground beef 4 ounces bacon, chopped ¬Ω cup chopped onion 1 (16 ounce) can baked beans with pork 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, undrained 1 (15 ounce) can butter beans, undrained ¬æ cup packed brown sugar ¬Ω cup ketchup 1 tablespoon dry mustard 2 teaspoons white vinegar salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir beef, bacon, and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain fat. Combine baked beans with pork, kidney beans, and butter beans in a large bowl. Stir in brown sugar, ketchup, mustard, and vinegar. Add cooked beef mixture; mix thoroughly and season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Melissa Goff Recipe Tip You can also put all the ingredients into a slow cooker and cook on Low, about 8 hours. I Made It Print 561 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Calico Bean Casserole 01 of 24 Photo by¬† Melissa Goff 02 of 24 Photo by¬† DREGINEK 07/21/2024 This is one of those recipes you see at hundreds of potlucks any season - often, brought by some aunt üòâ - yet, for me, I have never made it. I wanted to pair this with our 4th of July ribs. While finding butter beans was quite the feat (4 stores!) it was worth it. I am sure Northern Beans are a good sub but when your feeling nostalgic- you want the closest replicate as possible. Since it rained 4th of July, the ribs moved to the oven and the beans got moved to the crockpot - on high - for 3hours and then the last, fourth hour; uncovered in the crockpot (still on high). This allowed them to thicken to the consistency I remembered. Move over Aunts! I can do this too now! Thanks Dee Dee! It was delicious!! 03 of 24 Photo by¬† Ashley 04/17/2021 I followed the recipe and then added bbq sauce. It turned out great! 04 of 24 Photo by¬† Linda Rosinski 04/12/2020 05 of 24 Photo by¬† Lisa 07/29/2019 I made this dish for my church‚Äôs picnic. The only thing I did was adding a green bell pepper the best tasting beans I ever tasted. They were gone less than half an hour! 06 of 24 Photo by¬† Lisa 07/29/2019 I made this dish for my church‚Äôs picnic. The only thing I did was adding a green bell pepper the best tasting beans I ever tasted. They were gone less than half an hour! 07 of 24 Photo by¬† Lisa 07/29/2019 I made this dish for my church‚Äôs picnic. The only thing I did was adding a green bell pepper the best tasting beans I ever tasted. They were gone less than half an hour! 08 of 24 Photo by¬† Mary Andersen 01/29/2019 Wow this is delicious.( I added a teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce , but didn‚Äôt need it) 09 of 24 Photo by¬† Charlotteh 12/09/2018 I drained the butter and kidney beans. It was good but next time i make it i will cook the bacon first. The mushy chunks werent very good. 10 of 24 Photo by¬† Linda Gibbs 12/05/2017 1 2 3 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Slow Cooker Cowboy Beans 116 Ratings Betty's 3-Bean Hot Dish (a la Minnesota) 19 Ratings Rancho Baked Beans 8 Ratings Better Than Ice Cream Baked Beans 4 Ratings Chef John's Boston Baked Beans 95 Ratings Boston Baked Beans 1,390 Ratings Ryan's Favorite Beans 63 Ratings Slow Cooker Baked Beans 117 Ratings Cola Beans 67 Ratings Three Bean Potluck Casserole 54 Ratings Kansas Baked Beans 42 Ratings Slow-Cooked Baked Beans 18 Ratings Picnic Baked Bean Casserole 5 Ratings Slow Cooker Baked Beans Using Canned Beans 77 Ratings Sweet Barbeque Beans 83 Ratings Sue's Beans 15 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: Dee Dee
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir beef, bacon, and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain fat.;Combine baked beans with pork, kidney beans, and butter beans in a large bowl. Stir in brown sugar, ketchup, mustard, and vinegar. Add cooked beef mixture; mix thoroughly and season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish.;Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Melissa Goff
